articles.author: David Shepardson, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Investigators plan to push forward on Friday with efforts to retrieve the two aircraft involved in a crash in Washington that killed 67 people and raised questions about air safety in the U.S. capital.
articles.title: Investigators seek to salvage aircraft after deadly Washington crash

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Russian forces are slowly tightening the noose around the eastern Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk, a key logistical hub whose main supply lines are under threat nearly three years after Moscow invaded its neighbour.
articles.title: Russia closes in on key Ukrainian city, seeking gateway for future advances

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily, Samia Nakhoul
articles.description: The unusually direct U.S. intervention in Lebanon's sectarian politics appears aimed at capitalizing on shifts in the power balance.
articles.title: Exclusive: US seeks to block Hezbollah ally from naming Lebanon finance minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Friday it would free the father of the youngest hostages seized in its Oct. 7, 2023 attack on Israel and two others including a dual U.S. citizen in the next exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners.
articles.title: Hamas names Israeli hostages to be freed on Saturday

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov
articles.description: Russia on Friday condemned an executive order by U.S. President Donald Trump to build a new missile defence shield, accusing the United States of trying to upset the global nuclear balance and pave the wave for military confrontation in space.
articles.title: Russia condemns Trump missile defence shield plan, accuses US of plotting to militarise space

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain, France and Germany on Friday reiterated their "grave concern" over Israel implementing a law forbidding any contact between its officials and UN Palestinian relief agency UNRWA.
articles.title: UK, France and Germany reiterate concern over Israel blocking contact with UNRWA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Myanmar's ruling military has extended a state of emergency for another six months, state media reported on Friday, a day ahead of the four-year anniversary of a coup that plunged the country into chaos after a decade of tentative democracy.
articles.title: Myanmar junta extends state of emergency to support election preparations

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: More than seven years after the blaze that engulfed London's Grenfell Tower, some families of victims say they have been traumatised again by letters notifying them that human remains are still in storage which could be of their loved ones.
articles.title: UK's Grenfell fire families demand answers over unidentified remains

articles.author: Sonia Rao
articles.description: From the young woman brutally murdered and dismembered in a short-term rental apartment to the Olympic runner set on fire by her estranged boyfriend, a surge in violence against women in Kenya has spurred many to prepare themselves to fight back.
articles.title: Kenya's violence epidemic: women train to fight back

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesia's additional budget of 100 trillion rupiah ($6.14 billion) for its programme to give free meals to school children this year will add nearly 2 percentage points to the country's growth, an aide to President Prabowo Subianto said on Friday.
articles.title: Bigger meals budget to add 2 pct points to Indonesia's growth, president's adviser says
